data.title: Vectour Group
data.text:
With exposure in the “family business” at an early age, Reggie has innate operational insight in the transportation management industry. Reginald is a strategic and entrepreneurial professional with over 15 years of experience in the planning and execution of large-scale, high profile major bus transportation projects. Reggie’s management experience includes work on (2) Olympic Games (Vancouver- 2010 and London- 2012), (3) Democratic National Conventions (Denver- 2008, Charlotte- 2012, Milwaukee-2020), and many other mega transportation programs. Reggie also has extensive experience in the development and implementation of DBE community outreach programs, including working on over 60 transit projects nationwide since 2014.

Reggie holds a bachelor’s degree in Business Management from Morehouse College and is a graduate of the University of California, Los Angeles Anderson School of Business, Management Development Program.

Adelee Le Grand is a seasoned public mobility and transportation executive with over two decades of specialized expertise in strategic planning and community-focused transit solutions. Her impressive career spans across major cities including New Orleans, Atlanta, and Tampa, where she has spearheaded transformative projects and led robust strategic initiatives that have markedly enhanced urban transit systems and community connectivity.

Adelee’s executive tenure is distinguished by her adept coordination of transportation services for large-scale events such as the Super Bowl in Tampa and WrestleMania in New Orleans. These roles underscored her capability to manage complex logistics and ensure seamless transportation operations under the intense demands of nationally significant events. Further illustrating her leadership, Adelee directed transportation planning in the Southeastern United States for a renowned architecture and engineering firm, consistently prioritizing projects that cater to diverse community needs and foster long-term sustainability.

Her collaborative efforts extend to working closely with Metropolitan Planning Organizations (MPOs), regional commissions, and chambers of commerce, all aimed at improving transit infrastructure and championing sustainable community development. This extensive engagement has positioned her as a key player in regional planning, helping to shape transportation policies and initiatives that drive community growth and development.

As the Chief Operating Officer of Vectour, Adelee is responsible for steering the overall operational success of the organization. Her role encompasses strategic oversight, growth initiatives, and business development, propelling Vectour Group to new heights through innovative leadership and strategic foresight. Adelee’s vision for Vectour involves not only expanding operational capacity but also integrating cutting-edge technologies and sustainable practices that align with the evolving needs of modern urban mobility.

Adelee holds a Master of Science in Transportation Studies and a Bachelor of Science in Industrial Engineering from Morgan State University. She is a certified member of the American Institute of Certified Planners (AICP), actively contributing to the field through thought leadership in various professional forums and as a respected voice in transportation planning.

Omar Alvarado is a distinguished expert in integrated mobility solutions and finance with over a decade of leadership in the multi-modal mobility sector. As the Vice President of Transportation Planning at Vectour, Omar brings a wealth of experience in strategic planning, system redesigns, and stakeholder collaboration aimed at enhancing transit performance and expanding access across various type of transportation areas.

Omar’s background is rich with significant roles where he drove innovation and efficiency in public transit. He served as the Operations Planning Practice Lead, where he led project management for all transit and engineering projects and spearheaded system redesigns that notably improved service efficiency and customer satisfaction. His strategic initiatives at HART in Tampa, FL, as Chief Delivery Officer, included overseeing major system redesigns and workforce strategies that drastically reduced driver shortages and saved the agency nearly $2M annually.

His tenure at Keolis North America as Director of Business Development saw him leading system redesigns in cities like Greensboro, Reno, and Las Vegas, enhancing service efficiency and stakeholder satisfaction. As Director of Planning and Scheduling at Transdev North America, Omar guided significant transit operations, integrating cutting-edge technologies like mobile ticketing and real-time tracking that transformed user experiences.

Omar’s approach is characterized by a deep commitment to community engagement, utilizing public feedback to tailor transit services that meet community needs effectively. He has coordinated transit services for major events such as Mardi Gras and Jazz Fest in New Orleans, ensuring smooth operations and enhanced community engagement during high-profile events.

Omar has a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration, specializing in Finance from Hofstra University. His global perspective is informed by international work in Canada, France, and Colombia, where he implemented best practices that resonate with global operational standards. Omar’s professional accolades include being named in Mass Transit Magazine’s Top 40 Under 40 in 2018, highlighting his influential role in the industry.

At Vectour, Omar lead’s transportation planning initiatives that drive operational excellence, embodying the organization’s commitment to delivering high-quality, sustainable transit and shuttle solutions that resonate with community and constituent group needs.

With over two decades of dedicated service in transit management and operations, Joey McKelvey brings a wealth of expertise to his role as Vice President of Airport and Transit Operations at Vectour. Joey is charged with the critical oversight of operations at our airport shuttle services and transit related services, ensuring top-tier performance and service delivery.

Before his tenure at Vectour, Joey held the position of Assistant General Manager at RATP Dev, a France-based global transit company, where he honed his skills in managing large-scale public transportation operations. His strategic approach significantly enhanced operational efficiency and stakeholder engagement. Prior to this, Joey served as General Manager at First Transit, leading over 200 employees and managing service delivery for Cobb County Transit. His leadership was instrumental in driving improvements in service delivery and operational efficiency.

From 2011 to 2017, Joey was the General Manager at Transdev, where he led the Start Road Toll Authority contract, an initiative formerly known as the Georgia Regional Transit Authority. During his tenure, Joey was pivotal in building a constructive relationship with the local union, which was crucial in improving both the performance of the organization and its workforce. His efforts not only elevated the operational standards but also fostered a collaborative and productive workplace environment.

Joey’s long-standing commitment to operational excellence and employee relations has made him a key asset in the field of transit management. His extensive experience and proactive leadership continue to drive Vectour forward, enhancing our capabilities in delivering reliable and efficient transit solutions.

Damonde is responsible for all project based organizational effectiveness for the company, including major event operations planning, vendor procurement and management, innovation and operational excellence with a focus on driving growth.

Prior to Vectour, Damonde served as Business Process Analyst for the City of Nashville on behalf of KCI Technologies. Additionally, he held the role of Director of Transportation and Services for The World Games 2022 in Birmingham. As Director of Transportation and Services, Damonde owned responsibility for all transportation and parking strategic plans to ensure all athletes, spectators, dignitaries, and other stakeholders could access 20+ venues while maintaining a secure perimeter around each venue. Prior to his role at The World Games, he held various leadership positions in system implementation and operational transformation.

Damonde holds a Juris Doctor from the University of Alabama, School of Law. Also, an MS in Sport Management and a BA in Political Science and Business Management from the University of Alabama.

Jessica Malcom is a seasoned operations and project management executive with extensive experience leading and directing teams in fields such as organizing, capacity-building, fundraising, communications, program development and management, leadership development, and community outreach. Jessica is responsible for all of Vectour Groups day to day operations.

Prior to joining Vectour, Jessica worked as a political consultant and general manager with Hicks Evaluation Group. At HEG, Jessica managed several programs and campaigns including the company’s call center operations and served as an advisor to agencies, organizations, and individuals. Prior to joining HEG, Jessica served as the program manager for Georgia STAND-UP, an Atlanta-based community development nonprofit. At STAND-UP, Jessica coordinated with partners across the business, political, and nonprofit sectors to successfully establish and complete programs that directly impacted communities of color.

In her spare time, Jessica enjoys spending time with her daughter and family, working out, and traveling. One of her goals is to visit all the continents at least once.

TJ, a Georgia native, has more than 20 years of experience in government relations and Business development. In his role at VectourGroup, TJ is tasked with cultivating strategic business partnerships and relationships that will increase annual revenue.

In a previous government relations and business development role,TJ served as the South Eastern Government Relations and Business Development Manager for Central Processors. For Central Processors,it was TJ’s responsibility to cultivate strategic relationships throughout the SouthEast. Aside from Government Relations and Business Development positions, TJ has served as Senior Advisor to United States Senator Raphael Warnock, Senior Advisor to President Joe Biden in Georgia, various Atlanta Mayoral races, as well as, a vast collection of additional state and local races throughout the country.
